title: Mac OS X 10.9 Mavericks for ESXI
description:
This is what I created to install into ESXI
I followed the instructions at links below. 
This torrent contains the file that was generated.
Please help by seeding as long as possible. 
I can't have the file up 24/7. 
I will have it up when I can.


Credits for instructions go to original posters.
Info found at:
 <a href="
http://blog.macops.io/ESXi/VMware/OSX/Mavericks/Install/Fusion/2013/06/14/install-os-x-10-dot-9-mavericks-to-a-vm-in-esxi-5-or-vmware-fusion-5-dot-0-3/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://blog.macops.io/ESXi/VMware/OSX/Mavericks/Install/Fusion/2013/06/14/install-os-x-10-dot-9-mavericks-to-a-vm-in-esxi-5-or-vmware-fusion-5-dot-0-3/</a>












# Quick and dirty way to install OS X 10.9 Developer Preview on VMware Fusion 5.0.3 yayaya

$ hdiutil convert -format UDRW -o Desktop/maverick.dmg /Applications/Install OS X 10.9 Developer Preview.app/Contents/SharedSupport/InstallESD.dmg 
Reading Driver Descriptor Map (DDM : 0)Ã¢â‚¬Â¦
Reading  (Apple_Free : 1)Ã¢â‚¬Â¦
Reading Apple (Apple_partition_map : 2)Ã¢â‚¬Â¦
Reading disk image (Apple_HFS : 3)Ã¢â‚¬Â¦
.......................................................................................................................................................................................................................................
Reading  (Apple_Free : 4)Ã¢â‚¬Â¦
Elapsed Time: 40.132s
Speed: 121.3Mbytes/sec
Savings: 0.0%
created: /Users/pipo/Desktop/maverick.dmg

$ hdiutil resize -size 9g Desktop/maverick.dmg 

$ hdiutil attach Desktop/maverick.dmg 
/dev/disk2          	Apple_partition_scheme         	
/dev/disk2s1        	Apple_partition_map            	
/dev/disk2s2        	Apple_HFS                      	/Volumes/OS X Install ESD

$ sudo disktool -A disk2s2
diskutil: please use diskutil(8) instead of disktool
File system user/group ownership enabled

$ hdiutil mount /Applications/Install OS X 10.9 Developer Preview.app/Contents/SharedSupport/InstallESD.dmg 
/dev/disk3          	Apple_partition_scheme         	
/dev/disk3s1        	Apple_partition_map            	
/dev/disk3s2        	Apple_HFS                      	/Volumes/OS X Install ESD 1

$ hdiutil attach /Volumes/OS X Install ESD 1/BaseSystem.dmg 

$ sudo disktool -A disk4s2
diskutil: please use diskutil(8) instead of disktool
File system user/group ownership enabled

$ sudo ditto /Volumes/OS X Base System/ /Volumes/OS X Install ESD

$ hdiutil detach /Volumes/OS X Install ESD
"disk2" unmounted.
"disk2" ejected.

# Boot onto maverick.dmg
# Format and name target hard drive
# Launch Terminal

$ installer -pkg /Packages/OSInstall.mpkg -target /Volumes/Maverick HD
(...)
installer: The install was successful.
# Reboot
# Have fun with blonds

.-)
